column4: i see that APTonCD is quite outdated to this point, is there a newer program that saves all packages onto usb or cd for installation for later?
it says is only works for eft, fiesty and dapper
http://aptoncd.sourceforge.net/index.html
i'll try it later

i've have to clean install ubuntu 3 times since i got it. i love the distro but the only annoying thing about clean install is that i have to d/l all the pkgs again, but this should alleviate the problem
packages go into /var/cache/apt/archives. In theory, you should be able to burn those files to a DVD and then bring them back again whenever you want...
where's all the other packages? scattered around ie. ubuntu-restricted-extras, cups, etcetra
as far as I know, any/all downloaded packages go into /var/cache/apt/archives before being applied, and they stay there...
nope, i've only got about 22 there
1758 installed according to synatpic
er, you're doing network installs?
then unless something has changed, it either comes from the install medium or it gets downloaded and put in /var/cache...
not sure what you mean. All packages are deb packages...
i have ubuntu restricted extras, but it's not listed there
so try an experiment. Download something from restricted & after install, see if it's in /var/cache/apt/archives...
if it was installed off the DVD, it won't be there. But that's ok, because next time you install it will just come from the DVD again.
unfortunately not, it was upgraded from 8.10 and installed via live cd 8.10
well make up your mind. You said "the only annoying thing about clean install is that i have to d/l all the pkgs again".
well now the annoying thing is to figure out how to retrieve all the pkgs
it might help if you told us what your ultimate goal actually is.

my gui screwed up on 3 separate occasions and i found it easier just to clean reinstall, i'd like to be able to install these pkgs off a cd/dvd in the event of a clean install rather than having to wait hours to download and configure each time
sounds like what you really need is just a full backup of a cleanly installed system

you can download debs without installing using apt-get --download-only. The debs will be in /var/cache/apt/archives. Dunno how far you can get as the dependencies won't get updated until you actually install...
